subject: Rev. Al Sharpton Sets the Record Straight on Paula Zahn Now!
body:
Tonight On CNN Email







May  9, 2007








 





8 p.m. ET


 

Paula Zahn Now:  Rev. Al Sharpton


The Rev. Al Sharpton is being criticized for controversial statements against a Presidential candidate. Tonight, he sets the record straight. Watch 8 p.m. ET.




















Related:• Sharpton Accused of 'bigotry' after remark on faith







 
 





 




6:00 a.m. ET


 

American Morning


We're live in areas hardest hit by severe flooding.  How residents plan to get back to homes surrounded by water.










 





6:00 p.m. ET


 

Lou Dobbs Tonight


Special Report: China admits sending contaminated products to the U.S. Only 2% of food imports from China are FDA inspected.







7:00 p.m. ET


 

The Situation Room


What will be the next move in the battle over Iraq war funding?  The top House Republican, and a powerful committee Chairman - join Wolf in the Situation Room.







8:00 p.m. ET


 

Paula Zahn NOW


Rev. Al Sharpton is being criticized for controversial statements against a Presidential candidate.  Tonight, he sets the record straight.







9:00 p.m. ET


 

Larry King Live


The one and only Jane Fonda.  The living legend is still outspoken on politics, plastic surgery, working with Lindsay Lohan, and  more.







10:00 p.m. ET


 

Anderson Cooper 360


A teenager with a terminal illness and thousands of people rooting for him.  People he's met and inspired online.
